body_html:
Hello, I fixed this problem by installing python2.14 with unicode 4 instead of unicode 2. Thanks, John
…
On Thu, Nov 1, 2018 at 2:39 PM ymodak ***@***.***> wrote: TensorFlow is tested and supported on Ubuntu 16.04 or later. However there are users who have installed it on ubuntu 14.04 <https://taufiqhabib.wordpress.com/2016/11/29/installing-tensorflow-on-ubuntu-16-04/> . Were you able to install TF outside of virtual environment? Trying to understand if creation of virtual env is causing the problem. Also what is your pip version? — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. unicode 2.

Thanks,
John

body:
Hello,

I fixed this problem by installing python2.14 with unicode 4 instead of
unicode 2.

Thanks,
John

On Thu, Nov 1, 2018 at 2:39 PM ymodak <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> TensorFlow is tested and supported on Ubuntu 16.04 or later. However there
> are users who have installed it on ubuntu 14.04
> <https://taufiqhabib.wordpress.com/2016/11/29/installing-tensorflow-on-ubuntu-16-04/>
> .
> Were you able to install TF outside of virtual environment? Trying to
> understand if creation of virtual env is causing the problem.
> Also what is your pip version?
>
> —
